sources.title: Way Down South
sources.description: Title: Way Down South Summary: In the pre-Civil War South, a plantation owner dies and leaves all his possessions, including his slaves, to his young son. While the deceased treated his slaves decently, his corrupt ... Directed by: Leslie Goodwins, Bernard Vorhaus Actors: Production Company: Sol Lesser Productions Release Date: 21 July 1939 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 In the pre-Civil War South, a plantation owner dies and leaves all his possessions, including his slaves, to his young son. While the deceased treated his slaves decently, his corrupt executor abuses them unmercifully, beating them without provocation, and he is planning to sell off the father'e estate--including the slaves--at the earliest opportunity so he and his mistress can steal the money and move to France. The young boy doesn't want to sell his father's estate or break up an of the slave families, and he has to find someone to help him thwart the crooked executor's plans.

sources.title: Way Down South (1939) BOBBY BREEN
sources.description:
Stars: Bobby Breen, Clarence Muse, Ralph Morgan 
Directors: Leslie Goodwins, Bernard Vorhaus
Writers: Clarence Muse, Langston Hughes

In pre-Civil War Louisiana, a young orphan inherits a plantation with well-cared for slaves, but a mean-spirited executor plots to sell off the estate and flee to Paris with the proceeds. Released the same year as Gone with the Wind.

metadata.Plot: In the pre-Civil War South, a plantation owner dies and leaves all his possessions, including his slaves, to his young son. While the deceased treated his slaves decently, his corrupt executor abuses them unmercifully, beating them without provocation, and he is planning to sell off the father'e estate--including the slaves--at the earliest opportunity so he and his mistress can steal the money and move to France. The young boy doesn't want to sell his father's estate or break up an of the slave families, and he has to find someone to help him thwart the crooked executor's plans.
metadata.Actors: Bobby Breen, Alan Mowbray, Ralph Morgan
